example.text: Unfortunately, due to the political football and the fact that it was the suits, not the boots, making the decisions, we have no clear military objective, and that is why this has continued to be a failure.
It's important to understand that this is a starting point for negotiations. I want to emphasize that my vote this week was a vote of confidence in future Republican negotiations.

Watch my full remarks here. WATCH HERE WHAT'S HAPPENING IN WASHINGTON: ON THE FLOOR This week in the House, we passed the REIN IN Inflation Act , which will combat the administration's actions fueling rising prices.

WATCH HERE THIS WEEK IN COMMITTEE This week in the House Armed Services Committee, we heard from Secretary of Defense Austin and Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman General Milley on the FY24 Defense budget request. During my remarks, I presented Secretary Milley with drafted articles of impeachment for his dereliction of duty during the botched Afghanistan withdrawal.

When I went to Afghanistan, I thought it was to help to fight from this becoming a safe haven of terrorism. Instead, we have actually promoted, funded, trained, and actually made it a safe haven of terrorism.
The American people are not about endless wars. The American people are about us being involved in things that we have control over.

The United States is not the world's policeman, and it is incredibly unwise to promote this level of involvement in international disputes. However, Democrat and Republican Presidents alike have abused the powers of war granted under the 2001 and 2002 AUMFs, and Congress must act to reign back the executive branch's war authorities.
